intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. gredensis, commonly known as the Gredens rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. This subspecies is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude environments.
